name: Ninety-Nine
info: A Sinner who is adept at Physical Output. Increases lifesteal by 5%.
criminalRecord:
A well-known fighting fanatic in Syndicate who had long engaged in violent activities. When being hunted down, the subject resisted the MBCC by attempting assassination, kidnap, and assault, and is extremely dangerous.

Suspected to have colluded with an illegal Mania research institute in the past. The subject's special power and mental state are extremely unstable and may lead to catastrophic consequences if not strictly supervised.

--

After the vehicle hijack incident, the subject has not displayed any manic tendency and her corruption has mostly stopped. With Chief's help and Hella's company and care, the subject's moods are now stable and she rarely demonstrates violent or dangerous behaviors.

The subject has adjusted to life in detention well. She's cooperative with investigation and is willing to take part in missions assigned by Chief. She often performs impressively in battles.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Having been exposed to prolonged stimulation by multiple unknown drugs, the subject has an abnormally high blood temperature as well as boosted destructive power and aggressiveness. After the Legion hired the subject, it equipped the subject with a massive special alloy sword to realize that shocking destructive power.

+++* Awakening Signs
It's been detected that the subject's body was modified and catalyzed by drugs early on. After the artificial awakening, continuous Mania-inducing experiments further accelerated the uncontrollable mutation.

+++* Corruption State
The unnatural awakening has taken a toll on Ninety-Nine, making her highly mentally unstable. Since her special power consumes a lot of energy, the subject has a much bigger appetite than ordinary people. The entire right arm displays physical signs of mutation resembling those found in Corruptors.
interrogation1:
Shortly after their encounter while fleeing SALVA Hospital, Ninety-Nine turned herself in to the [[[Minos Bureau of Crisis Control |MBCC]]]. Muzzled and restrained, she is interrogated by The Chief about the [[[PARMA (organization) |Laboratory of Parma]]]. She attests that the researchers there would draw blood from her and inject her with substances, take her apart and reassemble her, and force her to fight opponents who she would almost invariably kill. The Chief asks her about Hella, and she says that Hella is the one who lit up her world and gave her freedom, and that she will always protect her -- surprising the Chief, as Hella had refused to talk about Ninety-Nine when they had asked her. At this Ninety-Nine, previously calm, begins to heat up. She asks the Chief about the MBCC prison riot, and whether they know where Hella is. When they confirm that Hella was unable to escape during the riot and is still at the Bureau, the rising heat of her body becomes so intense that it breaks the restraints holding her down. The Chief realizes that she turned herself in only for the chance to get close to and kill them in order to free Hella. She attacks the Chief but is held back by the [[[Shackles]]]. Her Mania increases rapidly, threatening to kill her as well or turn her fully into a monster, but Ninety-Nine insists she doesn't care so long as Hella becomes free. [[[Nightingale]]] and the guards shoot her, but her boiling blood pushes the bullets out of her body. Her assault is stopped only by Hella's voice coming over the intercom, distracting her long enough for Nightingale to inject her with a powerful sedative. Later, Nightingale reports that Ninety-Nine's Mania has progressed so far that she is almost more Corruptor than human, to the point that the Shackles are not even capable of fully constraining her. If she fully transforms, the mental feedback through will cripple the Chief. In order to prevent that, the [[[Framework Against Catastrophe |FAC]]] intends to execute Ninety-Nine.

It turns out Ninety-Nine surrendered for a reason, after all. During the interrogation, Ninety-Nine went manic unexpectedly, forcing the FAC to lock her in the most heavily guarded confinement room.
interrogation2:
Ninety-Nine has been moved to S-Class security. The Chief has been attempting to use the Shackles to halt Ninety-Nine's mutation, but with little effect, so the FAC forbids them from continuing to connect with her by the Shackles. As a last-ditch effort, the Chief instead goes to Hella and brings her to Ninety-Nine's cell. They reminisce about their time together in PARMA's laboratory and their escape, the first time that Ninety-Nine had ever seen the sun. Hella promises that she can free Ninety-Nine again now, but Ninety-Nine says that if Hella really meant that, then she wouldn't have stopped her from killing the Chief in [[[Syndicate]]]. Ninety-Nine goes Manic again and attacks Hella, who has to be rescued by the Chief. The FAC issues a transfer notice and takes Ninety-Nine away. Three days later, Hella flees while out of the Bureau on a mission, attempting to intercept the FAC vehicle bringing her to her execution. The Chief and [[[Nightingale]]] agree they must go to get her back -- if she breaks Ninety-Nine out in this condition, she'll be killed.

Your Shackles cannot prevent Ninety-Nine's corruption from mutating and it will affect your mind if you force it. Also, Hella and Ninety-Nine had a quarrel and parted ways. You couldn't do anything but watch as the FAC took Ninety-Nine into custody.
interrogation3:
When the Chief and Nightingale catch up with the transport vehicle, they find it destroyed and Hella lying in a pool of blood beneath Ninety-Nine. The FAC's bullets cannot harm her, and unleashing the Shackles fries the Chief's mind without having any restraining effect. Hella attempts to hold her back, and Ninety-Nine beats her savagely. Still, the Chief hears Ninety-Nine's voice through the Shackles, asking them to kill her and save Hella. They apologize for being too weak to save her, but ask if Ninety-Nine truly wants to die, or whether she wants to see the sun. She says that she wants to live, and the Chief unleashes the Shackles again. They evolve, bringing Ninety-Nine's Mania under control. Ten days later, Ninety-Nine's infection remains stable and she shows no signs of going manic. She is still confined in her cell, but is not restrained like she was before. The FAC agrees to let her stay at the MBCC, but will check on her randomly and execute her if ever they find her out of control again. 85% of the Bureau's staff still believes that it is too dangerous to allow Hella and Ninety-Nine to be contained together, but the Chief insists that after both of them nearly died, allowing this is the least that they can do. Ninety-Nine thanks them for helping them control the monster inside her, and says that for the first time, she believes she can truly be free.

Your Shackles hold down Ninety-Nine. Her mind is a collapsing mess, which takes its toll on you and makes you extremely uncomfortable. But Ninety-Nine's will to survive and your determnation to care for Sinners evolve the Shackles' ability and enable it to control Ninety-Nine's manic status.
arrestRec1: The subject used to work as a hired gun in Syndicate and made a series of assassination attempts targeting the Chief of the MBCC. The MBCC failed to capture the subject even after sacrificing a great deal. In the end, the subject turned herself in for some unknown reason.
arrestRec2: The subject's early records have been purposely erased and are almost impossible to obtain, so both the subject's real name and origins are unknown. There are no social activity records for the early years of the subject. The subject was detained by the Laboratory of Parma for years to be used in human experiments in which the subject's blood was taken to enhance Mania Weapons.
arrestRec3: Experimental subject number ninety-nine in the Laboratory of Parma, the subject escaped from the lab with Hella's help and severely damaged the lab during the process. After gaining freedom, the subject lived with Hella in Syndicate.
arrestRec4: Having been separated from Hella, the subject was hired by the Legion in the West District and made a living by engaging in various illegal violent activities. Later, in hope of finding her best friend, the subject actively took part in all sorts of revenge missions in Syndicate targeting the power behind Parma.
servingTerm1: Fighting alongside certain powerful Sinners seems to have induced a sense of self-preservation in her, as the subject has begun requesting more intense training. If the requests are turned down, the subject will protest strongly.
servingTerm2: The subject lacks basic life skills and is terrible at all daily tasks such as cooking and cleaning. Failing in doing chores may even trigger the subject's quick temper and result in the destruction of surrounding facilities, therefore special supervision is needed.
servingTerm3: Surveillance footage shows that the subject is often seen together with Hella and rarely interacts with other Sinners. When Hella is present, the subject is significantly less irritable and may even seem calm and peaceful at times.
servingTerm4:
Influenced by Hella, the subject's hostility toward the Chief has greatly lessened. Once, the subject even initiated a conversation with the Chief to ask for larger food portions.
"I can't fight on an empty stomach."

**Ninety-Nine:** Aaahhh... Ah!

**Chief:** ......

supervision1:
++* âš  Friends

//You received an operation report about a dispatch mission.//

**System Notifications:** Hella was careless and got hurt on a dispatch mission. Though she recovered from such minor injuries very soon, the infuriated Ninety-Nine took it out on the attacker and almost killed them.

* **Prompt:** Express similar anger with Ninety-Nine
 * **System Notifications:** Hella and Ninety-Nine look happy.

* **Prompt:** Punish Ninety-Nine
 * **System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine just takes your punishment without saying a word.
supervision2:
++* âš  Master of Destruction

//The equipment development unit has sent a request for secondment of Ninety-Nine.//

**System Notifications:** The authorities requested to second Ninety-Nine to aid their equipment development, but quickly returned her.

* **Prompt:** Ask about the reason

**System Notifications:** Our assessment shows that Ninety-Nine's destructive power is not suitable for testing the defensive strength of soldiers' protective gear. It's more suitable for testing heavy armored vehicles.
supervision3:
++* âš  Special Strategy

//Ninety-Nine behaves as if her mind seems to be resisting the hypnotherapy.//

**System Notifications:** The hypnotist is having trouble communicating with Ninety-Nine, but the hypnotherapy is still progressing, though barely.

* **Prompt:** Look for a translator

**System Notifications:** With Hella's help, the therapy session is going a lot more smoothly.
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Enjoying the Clouds

//The weather is nice today.//

**System Notifications:** It's a sunny day. When you were taking a stroll in the Outdoor Activity Area, you ran into Ninety-Nine who was lying on the grass and enjoying the clouds.

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Chief:** Ninety-Nine?

**Chief:** Is Hella not with you? Now that's something you don't get to see every day.

**Ninety-Nine:** She got bored and went to watch TV.

**Ninety-Nine:** I thought I'd stay here and watch the clouds a little more.

**Chief:** So, you like the clouds, huh?

**Ninety-Nine:** I didn't like them before, but they grew on me as time went by.

* **Prompt:** Why?

**Ninety-Nine:** That is because when I escaped together with Hella and looked up, what I saw were clouds like this.
supervision5:
++* âš âš  Gone Rogue

//Emergency Notice: Ninety-Nine seems to have lost control. The energy overflow effect is extremely tense.//

**System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine the Sinner seems to have lost control. Go check on her immediately.

**Chief:** Ninety-Nine!

* **Prompt:** Calm down!
* **Prompt:** What's the matter with you?

**Ninety-Nine:** Where is Hella? What did you do to her?

**Ninety-Nine:** Give her to me. Now!

**Chief:** She is safe. Put down your sword!

**Chief:** I'll tell you only if you put that down.

**Ninety-Nine:** ...

**System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine slowly put her great sword on the ground. You feel relieved.

**Chief:** She is now playing with EMP in the Recreation Area.

**Chief:** They insisted on dueling each other in a shooting game.

**Chief:** ...
supervision6:
++* âš âš  Snacks

//Ninety-Nine wants to see you.//

**System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine the Sinner asks to enter your office. Approve?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Ninety-Nine:** This is for you.

**System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine walks into the office and puts a pile of snacks on your desk. You feel pleasantly surprised.

**Chief:** This is...?

**Ninety-Nine:** Hella gave them to me, but I can't eat all these by myself.

**Chief:** But it was Hella who gave them to you.

**Chief:** Are you okay with it if you just give them to me?

**Ninety-Nine:** It's fine.

**Ninety-Nine:** She handpicked these for you, saying that you might like them.

* **Prompt:** I'll take it, then.

**Chief:** Thank you.
supervision7:
++* âš âš âš  Emotion Control

//You hear the sound of a commotion from a distance.//

**System Notifications:** Ninety-Nine the Sinner lost control and damaged the TV in the Recreation Area.

* **Prompt:** Confirm

**System Notifications:** Restoring Footage... This Sinner used her great sword to destroy the TV monitor while it was playing a movie. The other Sinners got scared and scattered. Would you like to ask this Sinner questions?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Chief:** What was that about?

**Ninety-Nine:** A scene in that movie reminded me of the time when I was still in that place. I felt angry. I don't remember the rest.

**Ninety-Nine:** When I regained consciousness, I was already here.

**Ninety-Nine:** Did I hurt anyone?

**Chief:** You just broke the TV. Nobody got hurt.

**Ninety-Nine:** ...That's a relief.

* **Prompt:** Persuade her
 * **Chief:** You've got to try and control your feelings. Don't let them take over you.
 * **Chief:** We might not be so lucky next time.
 * **Ninety-Nine:** ...

* **Prompt:** Let her patch up the wounds first.
 * **Chief:** ...But you are hurt.
 * **Chief:** Go patch yourself up.
 * **Ninety-Nine:** ...Okay.
baseVoicelines: [Obtain the Sinner] You... are the one who imprisoned us. I remember your scent, I'll spot you wherever you are. [Raise to Phase 1] Be honest, do you want me, or a beast? [Raise to Phase 3] Now that you've granted me power, don't let me loose again -- one moment will be too much. [Level Start] Get ready. There will be blood. [Win Battles] Too soon, you scum, you gave up too soon! [Lose Battles] Let me go. It's not over yet! Let go! [Ultimate Skill] Ah! [Die in Battles] Am I... finally free? [Greeting] I knew it was you. I recognize your footsteps. [Conversation 1] They wanted my arms, wanted my blood, wanted me to tear everything down. They wanted to create a monster, and I was the masterpiece. [Conversation 2] My blade has sliced many. Among them, Hella is not the strongest, but she's the toughest. [Conversation 3] In that blood-boiling moment, the body acts on instinct. Don't think, forget whoever you've torn apart, simplyâ€”â€”enjoy it. That's how I'm designed. [Special Conversation 1] Chains? They're nothing. I'm used to them. Also, I can get rid of them anytime I want. [Special Conversation 2] I don't like how others call me. But I do like Ninety-Nine... It's the first name I've ever been given. [Special Conversation 3] I don't remember much about Parma. Only Hella's voice in the dark. She kep talking to me, telling me about Syndicate, what's above the ground, people. She said she'd take me with her. [Full Compliance] You're the second person I've wanted to kill but couldn't. From now on, I'll keep on fighting for you, until the day I die. [Idle] ... I'm hungry. [Annoyed] What... Do you want a fight? [Special Attention] Yeah, keep an eye on me, like how I'm watching you. [Dispatch] I'll... do my best. [Dispatch Complete] It's done, as you instructed. [Level Up] Interesting. [Pat Head]
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
I'm... Parma's living weapon, Ninety-Nine. Fight... Give me orders, I only need to fight...

[Greeting]
You're here... When does the next fight start?

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Fight, fight endlessly, until one side falls...

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Pain distracts you, so if you want to survive, you must get used to pain.

[Idle] 
You seem to be here all the time. What's your purpose?

[Annoyed]
Grrr... Grrr...

[Special Attention] 
If it's not for a fight, what are you here for? Am I useful in other ways?

[Level Up}
I'm stronger now... I'll give them a quick death.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Warm Redemption
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: Ninety-Nine will not die upon sustaining fatal damage, but instead becomes invincible for 6 / 8 / 10 seconds. This effect can only be triggered once per battle.

crimebrandSets.name: Off-tank
crimebrandSets.note: Decent way to ensure that she survives during battle if she is used as an off-tank.

crimebrandSets.name: Cheap Alternative
crimebrandSets.note: A very cheap alternative for if you have no other option.

shackles.title: Boiling Point
shackles.description: "Incinerate" state duration is extended by 3 seconds.

shackles.title: Carmen Lucia
shackles.description: Ninety-Nine obtains a 2% Attack bonus for each 10% Max HP reduction.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Furious Attack
skills.description: Ninety-Nine swings her huge sword, dealing (108% of Attack damage) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Incinerate
skills.description: Ninety-Nine enters "Incinerate" mode at the expense of her 50% current HP, and gains a 20% Attack bonus which lasts 13 seconds. While she is in "Incinerate" status, all damage to her will be delayed for 5 seconds, and she is not able to recovery her energy automatically.

skills.name: Ebullition
skills.description: For every 10% of Max HP lost, Ninety-Nine gains 2.5% Attack Speed bonus.

skills.name: Berserk
skills.description: Ninety-Nine deals 4% increased damage when attacking the same enemy, up to 5 stacks.
